courseName: Environmental Biology: Conservation & Resource Management MSc
facultyName: School of Biosciences, Geography and Physics
description: The MSc in Environmental Biology: Conservation & Resource Management explores relationships between living organisms and terrestrial, freshwater and marine environments.You investigate interactions resulting from natural and anthropogenic processes, benefiting from advanced training in the interpretation of local and global environmental issues.The Environmental Biology: Conservation & Resource Management course provides the skills and confidence to work in related fields such as environmental management and conservation.
duration: 1 year full-time; 2 years part-time; 3 years part-time
fees: FeesPlease visit our website for the Environmental Biology: Conservation and Resource Management course fee information.
